result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: per court on 10/6/22 - E: DA & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

3:02 PM Defendant Jordan James Kloos in Court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Jordan James Kloos.  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions missed appearance, Atty. Nelson advises that he got his dates mixed up.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates bond.  Court questions address and phone, Defendant confirms.  Adjourned at 3:04 PM
Plea hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:34 PM Defendant Jordan James Kloos not in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Jordan James Kloos.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch requests a warrant based on non appearance. Atty Nelson: no information. Court: Defendant was in custody when date was scheduled. Authorizes a warrant; adjoining states. 1:35
DE from PCJ

3:02 PM Jordan James Kloos appears in custody from Jail via video,  Atty Kaitlyn Dipplito appears by phone, DA Halle E. Hatch tor the State of Wisconsin. Court questions non-appearance, he had the incorrect date written down. Court will quash the warrant and reinstate the bond. DA Hatch is requesting a plea hearing since the case is resolved. Court confirms address and phone number, he will be moving out tomorrow but does not have a new address yet. Court adjourned at 3:07 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DA Hatch requests a warrant adjoining states. Atty Nelson: no information. Def did meet with Ms. Brill. Court issues a warrant; adjoining states.10:37
Plea hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:35 PM Defendant Jordan James Kloos in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel request the plea hearing be rescheduled; Defendant needs to meet with Ms Brill. Court reschedules plea. 2:36  Plea hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:46 am Jordan Kloos now appears, Atty Liesl Nelson, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State. Court will QUASH THE WARRANT and reinstate the bond. Attorneys would like to set a PleaH w/the Judge. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 10:49 am.

10:17 AM Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for Status at 10:15 AM.  Atty. Nelson advises she has not heard from yet.  State requests warrant, adjoining states.  Court authorizes warrant and will sign upon presentation.  Adjourned at 10:18 AM
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address. Court adjourned at 2:48 pm.

2:34 PM Defendant Jordan James Kloos appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Rick Huneke. S/T. DA Hatch questions Deputy. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. DA Hatch requests the Court find probable cause and bind DE over.  The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:07 PM Defendant Jordan James Kloos appears in custody from Jail via video, Travis Satorius appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS & NTO, no objection. Court so orders.  DE does qualify for PD.  Court confirms address and phone number. DE was active Army. Court adjourned at 3:14 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
